H0.text: Sediments are dropped when a stream or river slows down.

H1.text: Fragments are what a stream or river drops when it slows down.

H2.text: Organisms are what a stream or river starts dropping when it slows down.

H3.text: Pollutants are what a stream or river drops when it slows down.

A4.text: sedimentation is caused by flow velocity deceleration and erosion is caused by flow acceleration.

A5.text: Bed load moves by rolling, sliding, and hopping (or saltating) over the bed, and moves at a small fraction of the fluid flow velocity.
